channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
item.description: Sébastien Lecornu stepped down less than 24 hours after he had formed his cabinet.

item.title: Upwork CEO Hayden Brown: ‘There will be plenty of work for humans, even as AI agents do more’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Internal Audits Shed Light on Ukraine’s Secret Weapons Spending
item.description: The government reviews show the country’s challenge as U.S. support wanes and Kyiv pivots to production from a domestic arms industry with a long hist...

item.title: Trying to Survive Gaza’s War-Torn Present, and Hoping for a Future
item.description: Two years of intense warfare in Gaza have left its people with a dismembered and disordered society. The destruction is vast and many Gazans have ment...

item.title: Surprise in Japan’s leadership race jolts financial markets as the dollar soars against the yen
item.description: Takaichi favors looser fiscal and monetary policies, raising expectations that Tokyo will issue more debt while the central bank rethinks rate hikes.

item.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine Is Awarded for Work on Immune Systems
item.description: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi were awarded the prize for research showing how the body regulates its immune responses.

item.title: Gold and Bitcoin go through the roof as U.S. shutdown forces investors to trade in the dark
item.description: There is a 67% chance that the U.S. federal government shutdown will last longer than 10 days, according to bettors on Polymarket—and for stock trader...

item.title: We May Know Why Ernest Shackleton’s Endurance Really Sank
item.description: The explorer’s journey to Antarctica was likely doomed before it began.

item.title: What happens when C-suite pay becomes all or nothing
item.description: Inside the new era of high-stakes compensation that rewards only those who deliver outsize success.

item.title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
item.description: Sébastien Lecornu stepped down less than 24 hours after he had formed his cabinet.

item.title: Jilly Cooper, British Romance Novelist, Is Dead at 88
item.description: A prolific writer and keen observer, she sold millions of copies of her juicy, sometimes racy “Rutshire Chronicles” series.

item.title: We May Know Why Ernest Shackleton’s Endurance Really Sank
item.description: The explorer’s journey to Antarctica was likely doomed before it began.

item.title: In heavyweight movie showdown, Taylor Swift’s ‘Show Girl’ smashes The Rock’s ‘Smashing Machine’
item.description: “The Official Release Party of a Show Girl” debuted at No. 1 with $33 million in North America, according to Sunday estimates from Comscore.
